title: Is it bad to play on the highest settings?
body:
I notices FPS drops when there is a bunch of minions so I'm wondering if I have to lower one of them to avoid it or not.
Some insight would help. <3

Specs: (For the curious)
Intel Core i7-4790k 4.00GHz
Geforce GTX 1070
16 GB Ram
Gigabyte GA-Z97X-SLI

replies.body: FPS issues could be due to a few reasons, and not just quality settings.  There could be other settings or even game files failing to render that can cause frames to drop.  I recommend going over our [FPS Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide which has some instructions to help tune-up your computer.  Please let me know if you still experiences problems around minions after!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QEiB4EPc,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-07-19T23:43:21.081+0000)
>
> FPS issues could be due to a few reasons, and not just quality settings.  There could be other settings or even game files failing to render that can cause frames to drop.  I recommend going over our [FPS Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide which has some instructions to help tune-up your computer.  Please let me know if you still experiences problems around minions after!

I think it's the Shadow quality causing the issue with the minions on screen. Something that is so small and poops gold causes so much problems.

My specs are almost exactly the same.  I have the exact same model of i7, I have 8GB RAM, an MSI Z97, and an AMD radeon R9 290.  With these components I run 60 frames constant on max settings.  I would say that our GPUs are comparable in performance and obviously you have more RAM so you should not be having fps issues.  Do you have a water-cooler for the processor?  Also, have you tried messing with the overclock settings, specifically on the GPU?
